intro: Cassipourea guianensis var. guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan cassipourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are typically white or pale pink in color.
